name: Create a Tree

params.name: tree
params.description: Objects (of `path`, `mode`, `type`, and `sha`) specifying a tree structure

params.name: tree.path
params.description: The file referenced in the tree

params.name: tree.mode
params.description: The file mode; one of `100644` for file (blob), `100755` for executable (blob), `040000` for subdirectory (tree), `160000` for submodule (commit), or `120000` for a blob that specifies the path of a symlink

params.name: tree.sha
params.description: The SHA1 checksum ID of the object in the tree

params.name: tree.content
params.description: The content you want this file to have. GitHub will write this blob out and use that SHA for this entry. Use either this, or `tree.sha`.

params.name: base_tree
params.description: The SHA1 of the tree you want to update with new data. If you don't set this, the commit will be created on top of everything; however, it will only contain your change, the rest of your files will show up as deleted.

description: The tree creation API will take nested entries as well. If both a tree and a nested path modifying that tree are specified, it will overwrite the contents of that tree with the new path contents and write a new tree out.
